A friend of the star told Pop Eater, You would be a fool to count Christina Aguilera out. She has been down before and always found her way back. Sure, she's going through a lot and yes she is terrified, but mark my words, on Sunday when she opens the Grammys, no one will be talking about the Super Bowl anymore. This girl is in it to win it. Chrysler Canada, which owes about$ 1.7 billion to the federal and Ontario governments, says it is the first time that the company is voluntarily paying extra money to workers beyond contractual obligations. It's in recognition of an extraordinary performance of the industrial system of Chrysler in 2010, chief executive officer Sergio Marchionne told analysts after U.S. parent Chrysler reported its year-end results. The automaker is giving similar awards to 22,000 workers and 10,000 salaried employees in the United States. Parent Chrysler cut

But it contains few surprises and, after so many years of divisive debate, is unlikely to change many minds, writes Howard Kurtz .`` What is known is that he has in these 50 chapters marshaled his best defense; only history's final verdict remains unknown.''
